p.s: In line 13 Obama states that simple exchanges can break down walls between us.
Although I agree that it is helpful to do exchanges but I don't think it can completely break the wall on it'sits own.
The discussion of unfriendlyness between the two sides was mostly caused by a the terror attacks on September 11, 2001 and the bias the US-citizens had towards the Muslims after this.
The conflict is therefore too deeply rooted for the walls to be broken down by only doing some simple exchanges.
On the other hand I do think that they can help.
By getting the already motivated young Americans as Obama calls them take part in exchanges they can learn about one another and build relationships.
Concluded, in my opinion he is right that exchanges are a big part of relationships but I don't think they can mend this big of a conflict on their own.
